description:
Following the loss of their iconic vocalist Mangey Khan, the group begins a
new chapter with Bhura Khan--nephew of Lakha Khan--alongside dholak maestro
Magada Khan and multi-instrumentalist Sawai Khan. With spirit, innovation, and
pride, Barmer Boys continue to reimagine folk with attitude, carrying the
Manganiyar legacy to global stages.
name: Windmills Music Night - Barmer Boys

performer.description: Barmer Boys are the torchbearers of Rajasthan’s Manganiyar musical tradition, bringing ancient folk and Sufi sounds into the 21st century. Known for their soulful kalaams, Krishna bhajans, celebratory wedding songs, and electrifying jams with beatboxing, the trio has performed over 250 concerts across 25 countries, with appearances at Roskilde, WOMAD, FMM Sines, and NH7 Weekender.
performer.name: Barmer Boys

description:
Blending world sounds with contemporary jazz, MOCA's performances highlight
original compositions from each member, weaving their distinct backgrounds
into a cohesive, powerful sound. With creativity, craft, and connection at
their core, MOCA delivers music that is dynamic, heartfelt, and unmistakably
their own.
name: Windmills Music Night - MOCA Live!

performer.description: MOCA is an international instrumental quartet born from a shared passion for jazz in Amsterdam. The band unites three Cypriot musicians—Marios Menelaou, Odysseas Toumazou, and Christos Yerolatsitis—with Hungarian drummer Aron Nyiro. Their music reflects both rigorous training and rich cultural influences, further deepened through their time teaching and performing in Mumbai.
performer.name: MOCA Live!

performer.name: MOCA Live!

description:
His work spans heartfelt tributes to harmonica greats Toots Thielemans and
Mauricio Einhorn, cross-cultural collaborations across continents, and
inventive reimaginings of pop and rock classics. Named Best Brazilian
Instrumental Artist in 2023, Gabriel continues to expand the expressive range
of the harmonica, captivating audiences worldwide with his mastery and
creative spirit.
name: Windmills Music Night - Gabriel Grossi

performer.description: Gabriel Grossi stands among the world’s foremost harmonica virtuosos and a defining voice in Brazilian instrumental music. A prolific composer, producer, and performer, he has collaborated with luminaries such as Hermeto Pascoal, Milton Nascimento, Chico Buarque, Jacob Collier, and Snarky Puppy. Formerly part of the Hamilton de Holanda Quintet, Grossi has released 15 acclaimed albums that traverse jazz, forró, and Brazilian popular music—merging tradition with bold innovation.
performer.name: Gabriel Grossi
